programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Cavaliers try to file away the Magic as they clash in Game 6 of their East first-round series. Evan Mobley posted a double-double and contributed the game-sealing block in the dying seconds of Cleveland's 104-103 win over Orlando in Game 5.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Luka Doncic and the Mavericks try to finish off the Clippers in Game 6 of their Western Conference quarterfinal. Dallas took control with a 123-93 triumph in Game 5. Doncic is averaging 30.2 points, 9.2 rebounds and 8.8 assists in the series.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: The surging Maple Leafs visit the Bruins for Game 7 of their East quarterfinal. Toronto, which trailed 3-1 in the series, prevailed 2-0 in Game 6. The Maple Leafs haven't ousted the Bruins from the postseason since 1959, losing their last six tries.

programme.title: Formula 1: Grand Prix Sunday
programme.desc: Teams make final preparations for the day's race. Plus, interviews, features, and Martin Brundle's popular "grid walk."

programme.title: ESPN Films
programme.desc: Series of documentaries looking back through the history of sports.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight: Sunday Night Countdown
programme.desc: Leading into each of ESPN's Sunday Night Baseball telecasts is this special edition of "Baseball Tonight." Host Karl Ravech teams with analysts and reporters to present fans a detailed preview of the network's exclusive, national game of the week. Highlights of the day's other games, interviews with players and managers, and key storylines from around the league also fill the hourlong show. Mark Teixeira, Eduardo Pérez, Tim Kurkjian and Buster Olney are among the analysts.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: The Giants visit the Phillies in prime time. San Francisco's Logan Webb opposes Taijuan Walker, who makes his second start after recovering from a spring-training shoulder injury. Philadelphia's Trea Turner is 3-for-13 against Webb (3-2, 2.98 ERA).

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.desc: A staple of the annual AFC vs. NFC competition, the NFL's top players are set to participate in new and fan-favorite Pro Bowl skills competitions that showcase their football and non-football skills.

programme.desc: NFL rookies get their first taste of professional football at training camp.

programme.title: NFL Matchup
programme.desc: An NFL Films production, "NFL Matchup" is definitely a show for football junkies. Unlike traditional football preview programs, this one gives fans an in-depth look at some of Sunday's games by breaking down the strategy and tactics -- the Xs and Os -- through the exclusive use of team-supplied footage. That type of film study is a forte of former NFL player and executive Louis Riddick and NFL Films producer Greg Cosell, whose work is featured here alongside host Sal Paolantonio.

programme.desc: Jeanette Lee is an Asian-American billiards player who brought strength, sex appeal and skill to pool halls around the world; after her recent cancer diagnosis, Lee looks back on her storied career and opens up about her life.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: In the summer of 1998, the St. Louis Cardinals' Mark McGwire and the Chicago Cubs' Sammy Sosa embark on a chase of one of the game's most hallowed records, igniting the passion and imagination of fans and non-fans everywhere.

programme.title: Redemption Road: The Path Back to Glory - Lomachenko vs. Kambosos Jr.
programme.desc: Vasiliy Lomachenko and George Kambosos Jr., a pair of former multiple titleholders, will fight for the vacant IBF lightweight world title as part of a world title tripleheader.

programme.title: UFC Fight Flashback
programme.desc: Enhanced replays of memorable fights.

programme.title: UFC Unleashed
programme.desc: When Khabib Nurmagomedov retired from MMA, the UFC's lightweight title was up for grabs. See the journey of the 155-pound belt following the Khabib Era, featuring Charles Oliveira, Dustin Poirier, Islam Makhachev, and more.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Professional basketball action from the NBA.

programme.title: UFC Fight Flashback
programme.desc: Enhanced replays of memorable fights.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: The Giants visit the Phillies in prime time. San Francisco's Logan Webb opposes Taijuan Walker, who makes his second start after recovering from a spring-training shoulder injury. Philadelphia's Trea Turner is 3-for-13 against Webb (3-2, 2.98 ERA).

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Start the day off right with Chris Canty, Evan Cohen and Michelle Smallmon providing an energizing and informative way to take on the day. Sports, life and laughter are what it's all about.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Hoop Collective
programme.desc: Brian Windhorst is joined by Tim MacMahon, Tim Bontemps, and other insiders to sort out life in and around the NBA world.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: ESPN Sports Betting Analysts Erin Dolan and Joe Fortenbaugh, along with host Tyler Fulghum, break down the biggest storylines through the lens of sports betting, with breakdowns, discussions and picks.

programme.title: The Point
programme.desc: ESPN's flagship hockey show featuring highlights, news, analysis, speed, skill and access to the biggest stars, stories and personalities of the game. Hosted by John Buccigross.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: From Marita Hynes Field in Norman, Okla.

programme.title: PokerStars Caribbean Adventure
programme.desc: Coverage of the annual poker tournament.

programme.title: PokerStars Caribbean Adventure
programme.desc: It's Final Table time in the $10k PCA Main Event. The winner set to receive a massive $1.5 million. Pedro Neves has the chip leader, but former EPT champion Artur Martirosian looks to add another major title to his impressive resume.

programme.title: AFL Premiership Football
programme.desc: From Sydney Cricket Ground in Sydney.

programme.title: Road to UEFA Euro 2024 Magazine
programme.desc: Updates on the path teams must take to qualify for UEFA Euro 2024.

programme.title: TMZ Sports
programme.desc: Gossip and exclusive stories about athletes' personal lives.

programme.title: TMZ Sports Weekend
programme.desc: Our news team constantly breaks exclusive stories featuring the biggest stars in sports.

programme.title: Greatest Races: NASCAR
programme.desc: From Feb. 20, 2011.

programme.title: NASCAR Race Hub Presents
programme.desc: Dive into the untold stories of racing legends, their groundbreaking innovations, and the pivotal moments that shaped the high-octane world of NASCAR, paying homage to the trailblazers who defined the need for speed.

programme.title: Kentucky Derby Preview
programme.desc: The best racehorses square off in the premiere races from across the country.

programme.title: Bassmaster Fishing Elite Series
programme.desc: Competition from the highest level of professional bass fishing tournaments.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: From Kansas Speedway in Kansas City, Kan.

programme.title: NASCAR Race Hub Weekend Edition
programme.desc: NASCAR Race Hub airs from the race track every weekend, delivering the latest on stories as they unfold in the garage, staying on top of the latest breaking news, the crashes, hot drivers and the real-time insights.

programme.title: ARCA Menards Series
programme.desc: From Kansas Speedway in Kansas City, Kan.

programme.title: NASCAR Race Hub Weekend Edition

programme.title: NASCAR RaceDay - NCTS
programme.desc: Behind the scenes and up-to-the minute reports from the garage prior to the start of each NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series race.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: The NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series returns to action with the Heart of America 200 at Kansas Speedway. Christian Eckes' fourth-place finish at Texas on April 12 was enough to give him the lead in the point standings, two ahead of Corey Heim.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: From Angel of the Winds Casino in Arlington, Wash.

programme.title: United Football League
programme.desc: The Battlehawks (4-1) host the Roughnecks (1-4) for a Week 6 battle. AJ McCarron linked up with Hakeem Butler twice in Week 5, including on an 80-yard touchdown reception, in St. Louis' 45-14 demolition of D.C. Houston comes off a loss to Birmingham.

programme.desc: From Minute Maid Park in Houston.

programme.desc: From Angel of the Winds Casino in Arlington, Wash.

programme.title: NASCAR RaceDay
programme.desc: Behind the scenes and up-to-the minute reports from the garage prior to the start of each NASCAR Cup Series race.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Denny Hamlin defends multiple titles at the AdventHealth 400 in NASCAR Cup Series action. Hamlin, who won here in 2023, picked up his 54th career triumph on April 28 in Delaware, moving him into a tie with Hall of Famer Lee Petty for 12th all-time.

programme.title: MLS Soccer
programme.desc: The Galaxy (5-2-3) aim to pick up their second victory over Sounders FC (2-5-3) this season when they meet at Lumen Field. Former Vasco da Gama attacker Gabriel Pec scored his first MLS goal for Los Angeles in a 1-0 win over Seattle on March 30.

programme.title: United Football League
programme.desc: The Defenders (2-3) try to make up some ground on the Brahmas (4-1) in the XFL Conference. D.C. has dropped back-to-back games to title contenders Birmingham and St. Louis. Jontre Kirklin caught a TD pass in San Antonio's 27-12 Week 1 win over D.C.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Denny Hamlin defends multiple titles at the AdventHealth 400 in NASCAR Cup Series action. Hamlin, who won here in 2023, picked up his 54th career triumph on April 28 in Delaware, moving him into a tie with Hall of Famer Lee Petty for 12th all-time.

programme.desc: A daily sports talk show hosted by Skip Bayless, where each day Skip is joined by a cast of NFL legends for passionate conversations about the biggest sports topics of the day.

programme.title: The Herd With Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Colin Cowherd and co-host Jason McIntyre break down the biggest stories and interview the biggest guests in sports.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Nick Wright, Chris Broussard and Kevin Wildes explore and energetically advance the biggest stories in sports to start the day.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: Emmanuel Acho, Joy Taylor, and LeSean McCoy bring a fun, passionate, smart, and energetic discussion to the biggest sports topics of the day.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Divisional rivals meet for the first time in 2024 as the Guardians and Tigers start a three-game series. Last season, Detroit ended a seven-year slide in the head-to-head set by going 9-4 against Cleveland. Kerry Carpenter (DET) notched eight RBIs.

programme.title: Inside the NBA
programme.desc: This Emmy Award-winning studio show, which airs following each NBA telecast on TNT, is hosted by Ernie Johnson, with analysis from Hall of Famer Charles Barkley and NBA champions Kenny Smith and Shaquille O'Neal. It's a mix of highlights, interviews and hijinks, notably the verbal sparring sessions between the outspoken Barkley and his straight man, Smith. The show also welcomes various guest analysts throughout the season.

programme.title: Béisbol Esta Noche
programme.desc: Si usted es un fanático del béisbol, entonces no querrá perderse esta noche de recapitulación donde se muestran los momentos más destacados de todos los juegos y actualizaciones de los que siguen en curso. Regularmente presentado por Karl Ravech, quien está acompañado por una combinación de analistas, como los ex jugadores John Kruk y Dave Winfield, el ex manager Terry Francona, y los periodistas Tim Kurkjian y Buster Olney.
